message_1: Suppose you are the organizer of a round-robin tournament in which every player has to play against every other player exactly once. How many games must be played for a tournament with 7 players?
message_2:
In a round-robin tournament with 7 players, each player has to play against every other player exactly once. To calculate the total number of games, we can use the formula for combinations:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of players, k is the number of players in each game (which is 2 for a one-on-one game), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

In this case, n = 7 and k = 2, so we have:

C(7, 2) = 7! / (2!(7-2)!)
= 7! / (2!5!)
= (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))
= (7 × 6) / (2 × 1)
= 42 / 2
= 21

So, there must be 21 games played in a round-robin tournament with 7 players.
